title: Regional Portfolio Manager - RFID (Remote Anywhere US)
description:
**Remote Work: Yes**

**Overview:**

At Zebra, we are a community of innovators who come together to create new ways of working to make everyday life better. United by curiosity and care, we develop dynamic solutions that anticipate our customer’s and partner’s needs and solve their challenges.

Being a part of Zebra Nation means being seen, heard, valued, and respected. Drawing from our diverse perspectives, we collaborate to deliver on our purpose. Here you are a part of a team pushing boundaries to redefine the work of tomorrow for organizations, their employees, and those they serve.

You have opportunities to learn and lead at a forward-thinking company, defining your path to a fulfilling career while channeling your skills toward causes that you care about – locally and globally. We’ve only begun reimaging the future – for our people, our customers, and the world.

Let’s create tomorrow together.

This position will own go to market strategy for the RFID portfolio in North America markets, represent voice of North America through ALM and PAC processes, assist on go to market readiness for key product/solution launches, and provide strategic sales support.

**This remote role must reside in the US with the ability to travel ~ 50%.**

**Please ensure resumes submitted clearly showcase RFID experience.**

 **Responsibilities:**  

* LEAD STRATEGIC PORTFOLIO PLANNING
* + Identify & drive investment priorities & portfolio strategies by BU aligned with NA needs
  + Own & maintain 0–30-month roadmap, Quarterly alignment with BU strategic planning
  + Drive North America revenue forecast alignment with NA leadership, BU and Finance
  + Create & drive cross functional go to market strategies with NA Sales, Channel, Marketing, and BU

* REPRESENT VOICE OF NA THROUGH ALM, PAC and PLMK PROCESSES (EXECUTION OF STRATEGY)
* + VoC throughout PAC processes in ALM/PLM frameworks – identify, prioritize, and drive NA regional product requirements
  + Ensure product definition & timely solution deliverables.
  + Identify and prioritize unique NA region product and solution requirements. This includes personas, use cases, business case, features, software, and accessories.
  + Provide MRD & PRD input during ALM and PLM processes.
  + NA sales approval point for assigned programs– ensure alignment with key stakeholders

* ASSIST ON GTM READINESS FOR KEY PRODUCT/SOLUTION LAUNCHES
* + Focus on product & solution readiness as trusted advisor to channel and vertical market leads.
  + Ensure that features committed are delivered as planned, utilizing RPM SOS Big Rules Framework
  + Quantify impact to NA sales when delayed
  + Drive awareness and report status with NA sales leadership

* STRATEGIC SALES SUPPORT
* + Provide domain knowledge & expertise via engagements with strategic customers and partners.
  + Maintain / publish sales enablement tools such as roadmaps on quarterly basis.

  
**Qualifications:**

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
* 8 + years of relevant customer/partner or supplier experience mapping technical solutions to customer requirements and identifying pain points for those requirements to be documented and mapped to a return on investment
* Familiarity with RFID and Location Solutions **(please ensure resumes submitted clearly showcase this experience)** required for external applicants, willing to be flexible on this for internal applicants
* Must reside in the US with the ability to travel ~ 50%

Preferred Qualifications:

* Demonstrated understanding of how products/solutions arrive, mature, and exit the market
* Stellar presentation skills presenting to end-user customers, partner audiences and internal stakeholders at the C-level
* The ability to communicate technical content to non-technical audiences
* Familiarity with customer and partner reasoning for on premises and cloud architecture adoption
* Familiarity with Zebra Professional Services business models and 3rd party partner (ISV/IHV/Integrator/Reseller) communities
* Bachelors or Advanced degree highly preferred
* Experience in product/solution planning, specifically in assessing market needs, prioritizing, mapping, and negotiating technical features
* Fluency in Microsoft office products and PowerBI

Zebra is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by law. If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance in applying for a position, please contact us at workplace.accommodations@zebra.com

Know Your Rights:

https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC\\_KnowYourRights\\_screen\\_reader\\_10\\_20.pdf

Conozca sus Derechos:

https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/22-088\\_EEOC\\_KnowYourRightsSp\\_10\\_20.pdf

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Zebra is a federal contractor and is committed to an alcohol and drug free workplace. As a result, all U.S. based employees are subject to the Drug and Alcohol Free Workplace Policy and Procedure.

  
  

Zebra Total Rewards includes more than just pay and is structured to meet the needs of our changing global business and evolving talent. We are committed to providing our employees with a benefits program that is comprehensive and competitive – including healthcare, wellness, inclusion networks, and continued learning and development offerings. We offer community service days, in addition to the traditional insurances, compensation, parental leave, employee assistance program and paid time off offerings depending on the country where you work.

**Salary:** USD 141300.00 - USD 211900.00 Yearly

Salary offered will vary depending on your location, job-related skills, knowledge, and experience.  
Additionally, all Zebra roles are eligible for cash incentive programs. For example, sales roles have additional opportunity to earn substantial variable compensation tied to quota achievement. In most other roles, the Zebra annual cash incentive program links Company and individual performance together. Some roles may also be eligible for long-term incentive equity awards.

To protect candidates from falling victim to online fraudulent activity involving fake job postings and employment offers, please be aware our recruiters will always connect with you via @zebra.com email accounts. Applications are only accepted through our applicant tracking system and only accept personal identifying information through that system. Our Talent Acquisition team will not ask for you to provide personal identifying information via e-mail or outside of the system. If you are a victim of identity theft contact your local police department.

title: Lead Customer Success Business Analyst
description:
Job Description

#### **Job ID**

LEADB014053

#### **Employment Type**

Regular

#### **Work Style**

remote

#### **Location**

United States

#### **Travel**

Up to 25%

#### **Role**

Lead Customer Success Business Analyst

**Company Overview**

With 80,000 customers across 150 countries, UKG is the largest U.S.-based private software company in the world. And we’re only getting started. Ready to bring your bold ideas and collaborative mindset to an organization that still has so much more to build and achieve? Read on.

At UKG, you get more than just a job. You get to work with purpose. Our team of U Krewers are on a mission to inspire every organization to become a great place to work through our award-winning HR technology built for all.

Here, we know that you’re more than your work. That’s why our benefits help you thrive personally and professionally, from wellness programs and tuition reimbursement to U Choose — a customizable expense reimbursement program that can be used for more than 200+ needs that best suit you and your family, from student loan repayment, to childcare, to pet insurance. Our inclusive culture, active and engaged employee resource groups, and caring leaders value every voice and support you in doing the best work of your career. If you’re passionate about our purpose — people —then we can’t wait to support whatever gives you purpose. **We’re united by purpose, inspired by you.**

The Customer Success Business Analyst role will support our Relationship Management team and the GTM Strategy & Planning team across UKG Globally. The responsibilities will revolve around analyzing data across our over 20,000 contracts and over $3.5B in recurring revenue per year, identifying trends, optimizing processes, and collaborating with Sales, Customer Success, Renewals, Finance, and our UKG Operations teams to maximize retention and revenue. The role will perform complex analyses of business goals, financial data, objectives, and needs of the general business environment. They will analyze key metrics, identify risks, and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure customer success and timely/accurate renewals.

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Work directly with Group Vice President (managing Renewals and Customer Success), VP of Customer Success, and Finance to analyze adoption trends and customer data to identify risks, opportunities, and areas for improvement
* Work with the GTM Advanced Analytics team and Finance to develop tools, dashboards, and workflows to improve efficiency and visibility
* Partner with members of the GTM function to provide program support for growth initiatives (i.e. Sales Plays, pipeline hygiene)
* Prepare and deliver reports on renewal performance, customer sentiment/retention, and revenue forecasts with deep collaboration across the Revenue Operations team in Finance.
* Track and report on key metrics such as renewal rates, sentiment, churn rates, and upsell opportunities for sales to engage
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline and enhance current Customer Success programs
* Assist in creating strategies for improving customer satisfactions and loyalty
* Communicate renewal insights and findings to key stakeholders and leadership
* Support procure to pay, budgeting, and resource planning
* Align and help manage territories for the CSM team during annual planning and ad-hoc onboarding territory planning
* Serve as the trusted advisor and go-to-resource for the Customer Success team for any questions relating to Salesforce, sales tools, and/or general ad-hoc requests
* Responsible for ensuring that Account data is accurate in Salesforce and other systems
* Direct liaison between CS and Salesforce Enablement team
* Create custom reports, dashboards, and fields to support CS
* Partner with Enablement team to build out and iterate upon Relationship Management New Hire Onboarding and Orientation
* Support Quarterly Business Review preparation and slideware

  
**Basic Requirements:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Finance, Data Analytics, or a related field
* 3-5+ years of experience supporting a Customer Success team with business analysis and project management
* Experience in SaaS or technology industries
* Strong desire for business partnership and pursuing a goal of being a trusted business advisor to field leadership
* 3+ years' experience in Excel, Power BI, and Salesforce.com is required
* Proficient in Microsoft Office including PowerPoint and Word
* Knowledge of subscription management software (e.g., Gainsight)

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication, with active listening and summarization skills
* Ability to proactively influence, advise, and collaborate with teams
* Excellent judgment, interpersonal, communication skills, and follow-through
* Ability to work in a team environment and cross-functionally
* Highly self-motivated, analytical with demonstrated problem solving, and have sound business decision making skills in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to build credibility, trust, and rapport with stakeholders at all levels

**Where we’re going**

UKG is on the cusp of something truly special. Worldwide, we already hold the #1 market share position for workforce management and the #2 position for human capital management. Tens of millions of frontline workers start and end their days with our software, with billions of shifts managed annually through UKG solutions today. Yet it’s our AI-powered product portfolio designed to support customers of all sizes, industries, and geographies that will propel us into an even brighter tomorrow!

Equal Opportunity Employer

UKG is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, disability, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, and other legally protected categories.

View The EEO Know Your Rights poster

UKG participates in E-Verify.

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Disability Accommodation in the Application and Interview Process

For individuals with disabilities that need additional assistance at any point in the application and interview process, please email UKGCareers@ukg.com.

  

The base salary range for this position is $99,800 to$143,450; however, base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge and location. This position is also eligible for commissions and restricted stock unit awards as part of total compensation. Information about UKG’s comprehensive benefits can be reviewed on our careers site at https://www.ukg.com/careers
company_description: At UKG, our purpose is people. Our love for all things HR and workforce management is matched only by our people-centered culture.

title: Analytics Strategy Engagement Manager 2025
description:
Aimpoint Digital is a premier analytics consulting firm with a mission to drive business value for clients through expertise in data strategy, data analytics, decision sciences, and data engineering and infrastructure. We're a dynamic team committed to solving our client's most challenging business problems in partnership with the industry's most innovative software providers. This position is within our analytics strategy practice.

**What You Will Do**

As an Analytics & AI Strategy Engagement Manager, you will act as a trusted strategic advisor to our clients—partnering with business leaders, data owners, and C-suite executives to shape their Data, Analytics, and AI transformation agendas. You will work at the intersection of business, technology, and innovation, driving value through enterprise data strategies, AI enablement, data product development, and monetization initiatives. You will assess the current state of clients' data landscapes, AI readiness, and analytics maturity through structured stakeholder interviews, workshops, and diagnostic frameworks. Based on this, you will determine business needs and desired future state capabilities or products and quantify expected value and business impact. You'll partner closely with business stakeholders and our Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Data Analysts to define target state architectures, use cases, operating models, governance, and strategic roadmaps that turn data into scalable, monetizable assets or analytics & AI solutions for the business. Additionally, you will drive the development and evolution of our go-to-market offerings across Enterprise Data Strategy, AI Strategy, and Data Product & Monetization Strategy.

**Who We Are Looking For**

We are seeking strategic thinkers and innovation leaders who are passionate about the transformative potential of AI, data, and analytics to deliver real business value. You are a highly skilled communicator and problem solver who can bridge the gap between technical teams and business decision-makers. You bring a deep understanding of modern data architectures, data product management, AI/ML applications, Data & AI solution development and data monetization models, and know how to translate them into executable strategies. You are a driven self-starter who thinks strategically but can also define the practical steps required to execute that strategy successfully. You are interested in constantly learning, proactively developing expertise based on best practices and industry trends and understanding the latest analytical applications to paint the art of the possible for our clients. You thrive in ambiguity and possess a blend of consulting acumen, domain knowledge, and entrepreneurial drive. In this leadership role, you will own client engagements end-to-end, drive practice development, mentor team members, and actively scope projects, contribute to sales and growth of our Strategy offerings.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead the development of Enterprise Data & AI strategies, aligned to business objectives and designed to scale across the organization
* Define, design, and operationalize data products by identifying high-value data use cases, customer needs, and internal efficiencies
* Develop data monetization strategies, including internal value creation (e.g., operational efficiency, personalization) and external revenue models (e.g., data-as-a-service, API products)
* Evaluate current-state analytics and AI maturity across people, process, technology, and data; identify gaps and develop actionable roadmaps
* Collaborate with data scientists and AI/ML teams to define AI use cases, prioritize roadmaps, and design strategic AI frameworks to deliver AI at scale
* Design modern data governance models that support Analytics & AI enablement, regulatory compliance, and trusted data consumption.
* Work closely with cross functional teams to define future-state data architectures, data pipelines, MLOps frameworks, and product lifecycle workflows.
* Define value proposition and track KPIs to measure business impact of data products and AI solutions.
* Lead stakeholder alignment workshops, executive briefings, and change management initiatives to ensure adoption of strategies
* Create practice accelerators including delivery frameworks, maturity assessments, templates, and POVs for AI Strategy, Data Products, and Monetization.
* Support sales and business development by shaping proposals, participating in client pursuits, and driving thought leadership.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree required; Master's in Business or related field preferred
* 5+ years of recent experience leading Data & Analytics or AI projects & teams or similar leadership role in a large-scale, complex organization
* 5+ years of strategy development and execution experience
* 3+ years in client-facing advisory roles, ideally within top-tier consulting firms or innovation-driven companies
* Experience leading engagements in Enterprise data strategy, AI strategy, data product design and development, or data monetization initiatives
* Strong Analytical skills with experience in business case development and strategic planning
* Strong understanding of AI/ML concepts (e.g., supervised/unsupervised learning, NLP, GenAI) and their business applications
* Proven track record of developing data governance and AI governance programs, including ethical and regulatory considerations
* Deep knowledge of data product management principles, including product lifecycle management, data service design, and go-to-market strategy.
* Familiarity with monetization models such as tiered data services, embedded analytics, and data marketplaces
* Familiarity with modern data platforms and tools: Snowflake, Databricks, Azure, AWS, GCP, dbt, coalesce, Dataiku, Alteryx, Sigma, Alation, Tableau, Power BI
* Working knowledge of AI/ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch), RPA, and MLOps practices is a plus
* Certifications such as Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP), PMI-ACP, or AI Governance/Responsible AI are a plus

We are actively seeking candidates for full-time, remote work within the US or UK. Atlanta-based applicants will have the opportunity to work in our headquarters in Sandy Springs, GA.

title: Regional Territory Manager (LA Based)
description:
**About Us:**
-------------

  

Join the team at OpenDrives, a rapidly growing data services company that is dedicated to solving complex technology problems with innovative yet practical solutions. Our customers range from Hollywood blockbusters, to medical imaging specialists, to academia, and everything in between. Our company's core values are summed up in the word OPEN, which stands for open-mindedness, persistence, effectiveness, and nimbleness. We are looking for empathetic, self-starting professionals who are passionate about exceeding customer expectations and who thrive in a collaborative, supportive environment. If you're a curious listener, with a commitment to excellence, and want to be part of an organization that is dedicated to solving real-world data management challenges, we invite you to apply to join our team today.

  

**About the Role:**
-------------------

We are looking for an experienced Los Angeles based Regional Territory Manager with a familiarity, focus, and understanding of Media and Entertainment workflows to join our Sales Team. The Sales team at OpenDrives is responsible for sales activities ranging from: prospecting targeted accounts/verticals, sourcing leads, qualifying opportunities, working with channel partners, and presenting initial virtual and live presentations to prospective clients and partners. As a Regional Territory Manager, you will have a direct impact on the success of the company through your ability to effectively cultivate our current relationships and drive new opportunities within the Media and Entertainment market.

This role requires residency in the Los Angeles area, as it involves occasional in-person meetings, customer visits, and partner events—often on short notice—to support and strengthen relationships with our LA-based clients and channel partners.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**
------------------------------------------

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Prospect to identify net new opportunities in the Media & Entertainment segment
* Manage an established book of accounts
* Meet/exceed assigned goal on a quarterly basis
* Identify, qualify and set appointments
* Deep understanding and research on key target accounts in Media & Entertainment
* Work closely with Field Marketing to develop outbound call campaigns
* Help progress opportunities as needed and directed with field Account Executives
* Handle project upsells and renewals as needed
* Qualify and respond to marketing generated leads
* Help drive attendance to company events via email and/or calls
* Work with Channel on outbound prospecting campaigns with partners
* Communicate with Marketing on strategy, lead generation, lead programs
* Continually keep up with current storage trends, companies, news releases, and competitor news
* Daily use of sales enablement tools including but not limited to Salesforce.com, Discover.org, Gmail, LinkedIn toward the goal of effective pipeline management and data entry hygiene
* Travel required as needed for client and partner visits

**Competencies and Skills:**
----------------------------

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following.

* Consistent track record of exceeding quota and penetrating net-new accounts
* Ability to effectively manage and prioritize various sales-related activities and fluently adapt to shifting priorities
* Leverage your existing established relationships within your assigned territory
* Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills
* Create and deliver an ROI/TCO detailed proposal
* Ability to clearly communicate OpenDrives business value to varying roles in an IT organization including the “C” suite
* Strong organizational skills and effective time management
* Demonstrated ability to optimize performance and drive results in a fast-paced environment
* Proficient with Salesforce or related software
* Proficient with Google Suite or related software

**Education and Experience:**
-----------------------------

* Minimum 3 years of experience in high tech storage/software sales
* BA/BS Degree required- prior work experience will be considered as a suitable alternative
* Workflow knowledge of Media and Entertainment a requirement, but some or all of the following verticals:
  + HPC/Research/Scientific Computing
  + Corporate Video
  + Ideally have successfully worked in early-stage companies

**Physical Demands:**
---------------------

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is frequently required to talk or hear; stand and walk. The employee must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. This job operates partially in a clerical, office setting, but also includes on-site visits to customer locations depending on the territory.

  

**Work Environment:**
---------------------

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

The above job description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor.

**Benefits:**
-------------

We have some awesome perks if you want to work with us.

* Incredible vacation policy and flexible schedule
* Great health, dental, and vision insurance
* Employer and Employee Paid Life Insurance & AD&D Options
* Voluntary Short & Long Term Disability Options
* Flexible Spending Account/Health Savings Account Options
* Employee Assistance Program
* 401(k)
* Options for hybrid remote/office work, or full remote
* Cell Phone and Internet Allowance
* A culture of empathy and empowerment

**Pay Scale Disclaimer:**
-------------------------

The hiring base salary range for this role is $110,000.00-$130,000.00 USD annually.

Please note that the compensation information provided is a good faith estimate for this position only and is provided pursuant to the California Salary Transparency in Job Advertisements Law. OpenDrives takes into consideration a candidate's education, training, and experience, external market and internal value, including seniority and merit systems, and internal pay alignment when determining the salary level for potential new employees. In compliance with the California Law, a potential new employee's salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.

title: Analytics Strategy Consultant 2025
description:
Aimpoint Digital is a premier analytics consulting firm with a mission to drive business value for clients through expertise in data strategy, data analytics, decision sciences, and data engineering and infrastructure. We're a dynamic team committed to solving our client's most challenging business problems in partnership with the industry's most innovative software providers. This position is within our analytics strategy practice.

**What you will do**

You will become a trusted advisor working closely with our clients, from data owners and analytic users to C-level executives to shape their Data, Analytics and AI transformation agendas. You will work at the intersection of business, technology, and innovation, driving value through enterprise data strategies, AI enablement, data product development, and monetization initiatives. You will assess the current state of clients' data landscapes, AI readiness, and analytics maturity through structured stakeholder interviews, workshops, and diagnostic frameworks. Based on this, you will determine business needs and desired future state capabilities or products and quantify expected value and business impact. You'll partner closely with business stakeholders and our Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Data Analysts to define target state architectures, use cases, operating models, governance, and strategic roadmaps that turn data into scalable, monetizable assets or analytics & AI solutions for the business. Additionally, you will contribute to practice offerings and assets around topics such as Enterprise Data Strategy, AI Strategy, and Data Product & Monetization Strategy.

**Who we are looking for**

We are looking for strategists who are passionate about the ability of data and analytics to transform business and deliver value. We are looking for someone who is a strong communicator, problem solver, team-player, and can be a trusted advisor to our clients. You can translate complex data and analytics needs into plain English for our clients and provide the business context for our Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Data Analysts so they can provide solutions that truly align with business objectives and deliver real value. You are a driven self-starter who is comfortable with ambiguity, can strategically address problems, operate independently, but also escalate and ask for guidance appropriately. You are interested in constantly learning, proactively developing expertise based on best practices and industry trends and understanding the latest developments with AI & data applications. You are passionate about contributing to Analytics strategy offerings and strategic asset development. An Analytics Strategy Consultant will also be expected to be able to completely own and manage all strategy deliverables for a client engagement.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Develop Enterprise Data & AI strategies, aligned to business objectives and designed to scale across the organization.
* Define, design, and operationalize data products by identifying high-value data use cases, customer needs, and internal efficiencies.
* Develop data monetization strategies, including internal value creation (e.g., operational efficiency, personalization) and external revenue models (e.g., data-as-a-service, API products).
* Evaluate current-state analytics and AI maturity across people, process, technology, and data; identify gaps and develop actionable roadmaps.
* Collaborate with data scientists and AI/ML teams to define AI use cases, prioritize roadmaps, and design strategic AI frameworks to deliver AI at scale
* Design modern data governance models that support Analytics & AI enablement, regulatory compliance, and trusted data consumption.
* Work closely with cross functional teams to define future-state data architectures, data pipelines, MLOps frameworks, and product lifecycle workflows.
* Define value proposition and track KPIs to measure business impact of data products and AI solutions.
* Lead stakeholder alignment workshops, executive briefings, and change management initiatives to ensure adoption of strategies

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's in a quantitative field or Master's degree in Business
* Strong communication skills (oral, verbal, and listening) with ability to influence key decision-makers
* 2-4 years of data strategy experience
* 1-3 years in client-facing advisory roles, ideally within top-tier consulting firms or innovation-driven companies
* Experience developing Analytics and Data Strategy deliverables (e.g. Operating model design, Use Case Definition, Strategic Roadmap Creation, Self Service Analytics Strategy, etc.)
* Familiarity with modern data platforms and tools: Snowflake, Databricks, Azure, AWS, GCP, dbt, coalesce, Dataiku, Alteryx, Sigma, Alation, Tableau, Power BI
* Working Knowledge AI/ML concepts, and AI/ML frameworks, RPA, and MLOps
* Knowledgeable on data product management principles, including product lifecycle management, data service design, and go-to-market strategy.
* Strong analytical skills with demonstrable experience in outlining business cases or value driven strategic recommendations
* Experience in being a part of or applying structured organizational change management approaches across all facets of analytics-related change preferred

We are actively seeking candidates for full-time, remote work within the US or UK. Atlanta-based applicants will have the opportunity to work in our headquarters in Sandy Springs, GA.

title: Director of Sales Operations
description:
**Join Us as Director, Sales Operations!**

ORBCOMM is seeking a **dynamic and strategic Director of Sales Operations** to lead, innovate, and empower our global sales organization. This leadership role is pivotal in aligning sales processes, technology, and strategy to our ambitious revenue and growth goals.

**Why You’ll Love Working Here:**

This is your opportunity to shape the future of ORBCOMM's sales operations by driving efficiency, enabling seller success, and implementing cutting-edge solutions. You will collaborate with teams in sales, marketing, and finance to deliver high-impact results. As Director, Sales Operations, you will provide actionable insights, optimize systems, and implement transformational initiatives that accelerate sales performance.

This role can be held remotely anywhere along the East Coast, U.S. (Must be in EST)

### **What You’ll Do:**

* **Lead Sales Operations:** Oversee global sales processes, drive pipeline growth and CRM data integrity, ensuring alignment across sales regions and business units.
* **Dashboards and Reporting**: Build and maintain salesforce and offline reporting assets to support efficient information dissemination across sales leaders and ORBCOMM executives.
* **Sales Incentive Plan (SIP) Design**: Lead SIP modeling, incentive plan design, performance tracking, and communication.
* **Set and Achieve Targets:** Define clear sales goals and expectations, ensuring alignment with the company’s objectives.
* **Innovate and Optimize:** Design and refine sales systems, processes, and tools to streamline operations and drive efficiency.
* **Deliver Insights:** Provide metrics, and analyses to track sales performance, pipeline growth, and forecasting accuracy.
* **Collaborate Globally:** Partner with sales, marketing, customer experience, operations, and finance teams to ensure seamless sales planning, budgeting, and execution.
* **Drive the Sales Enablement Function:** Devise, implement and maintain playbooks and training programs that equip sellers with the tools and knowledge to succeed.

### **Who You Are:**

You’re a strategic thinker with a knack for operational excellence, ready to tackle multiple priorities with agility and grace. If you have:

* **Sales Operations Mastery:** Deep understanding of CRM systems (Salesforce), sales compensation, forecasting, analytics, and enablement tools.
* **Strategic and Analytical Mindset:** Skilled in driving data-driven decisions, creating actionable insights, and solving complex problems.
* **Leadership Excellence:** A collaborative leader with experience managing cross-functional initiatives and mentoring high-performing teams.
* **Innovative and Adaptability:** Passionate about building and innovating upon existing structures. Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, maintaining focus and composure under pressure.
* **Job Experience:** 5+ years in sales operations, revenue operations, or business operations in technology/ software/ similar industries, preferably with 1 to 2 years in a Private Equity-backed environment.
* 25% travel required

Then we want to meet you!

**About Us:**

At ORBCOMM, we’re pioneers in IoT technology, that drives innovation and empowers our clients to make data-driven decisions. Our industry-leading solutions enable customers to boost productivity, streamline operations and increase their bottom line. With over 30 years of experience and the most comprehensive solution portfolio in the industry, we enable the management of millions of assets worldwide across diverse sectors including transportation, heavy industries, satellite, and maritime. Discover how ORBCOMM is transforming industries and unlocking the potential of data to drive meaningful change by visiting us at www.orbcomm.com!

**Ready to Join Us?**

We believe that our people are our greatest asset. Your skills and passion can help us achieve remarkable things! If you’re seeking a thrilling career opportunity in a vibrant, growth-oriented environment, ORBCOMM is the perfect fit for you.

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and appreciate all applicants for their interest in joining our team. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

At ORBCOMM, we are also dedicated to ensuring accessibility and are pleased to offer accommodations for individuals with disabilities upon request throughout all aspects of the selection process.

title: Senior Partner Enablement Specialist
description:
**✨ One Platform, a Whole World Of Opportunity**
Right now, the best jobs are limited to people in a handful of the world’s wealthiest cities, yet brilliant people are
*everywhere*
. Driven to overturn the status quo and distribute opportunities equally around the world, Oyster launched its global employment platform to help companies hire, pay, and care for talent anywhere.
  
  
When It Comes To Global Employment, We Walk The Walk. We’re Proof That Companies Don't Need An Office To Create a Highly-engaged Culture. Since The Company’s Inception In January 2020, Oyster Has
  
  
🌏 Created a fully-distributed, vibrant team of 500+ employees across 60+ countries
  
  
👩‍💻Featured in Forbes having ranked #9 in Flexjobs Top 30 Companies for remote jobs
  
  
🌈 Established a diverse leadership team and an employee base that’s 60% female
  
  
🏆 Achieved one of the highest employee engagement scores in its class
  
  
🦄 Raised $286 million to date, with a current valuation of $1.2 billion!
  
  
💚 B Corp status achieved in 2023
  
  
Our momentum speaks to the power of global employment—and we’re just getting started! If you want to change the world with Oyster
*and*
be empowered to work remotely while doing so, we’d love for you to apply!
  
  
**Location:**
While this position is posted in a specific location, all of Oyster’s positions are fully remote and you can work from home. Ideal candidates will be based in North America with the ability to regularly travel.
  
  
The Senior Partner Enablement Specialist will be a key member of the Oyster partnerships team. At Oyster, the partnerships team is responsible for sourcing and developing strategic partner relationships with complementary organizations to drive both revenue and corporate development opportunities. The Partner Enablement Specialist will take a lead role in engaging with and enabling our partners by facilitating virtual and onsite events. These will be a mix of planned and impromptu events that center around strengthening relationships with partner stakeholders and educating partner sales teams on Oyster’s products and services.
  
  
**Key Responsibilities**

* Plan and execute engaging partner enablement events (both virtual and onsite) in close collaboration with Oyster’s partner management team.
* Deliver high-impact partner training sessions tailored to various stakeholder groups within partner organizations.
* Cultivate deep, trusted relationships with partner sales and marketing teams to drive lead referrals, co-marketing opportunities, and joint success.
* Represent Oyster at conferences, webinars, and partner-facing events to promote our brand and deepen strategic relationships.
* Act as a subject matter expert on the global employment landscape, Oyster’s platform, competitive positioning, and partner value proposition.
* Directly manage select partner relationships, nurturing them into long-term strategic alliances.
* Serve as a feedback loop to internal teams on partner needs, competitive intelligence, and enablement gaps.

**Core Requirements**

* 5+ years of experience in B2B partner/channel, sales, or a similar role—preferably in a high-growth SaaS or technology environment.
* Experience in the HR Tech, SaaS, or global employment industry.
* Familiarity with global partner ecosystems and co-marketing initiatives.
* Proven experience facilitating both in-person and virtual events and training programs with external stakeholders.
* Demonstrated ability to build relationships across all levels of partner organizations—especially sales, marketing, and GTM teams.
* Deep understanding of partner program structures and channel sales models.
* Strong project management and cross-functional collaboration skills.
* Exceptional communication, facilitation, and presentation abilities.
* Experience working in a fast-paced, remote-first environment.
* Strong interpersonal skills; confident in being the face of the brand at events.
* Willingness and ability to travel regularly for onsite partner engagements and conferences.
* Highly organized with a proactive, hands-on approach to planning and execution.

**You'll also need**

* A reliable home internet connection (or be able to get one)
* Fluent English language skills

**🦪 How We Work Together At Oyster**
Our values guide the work we do, the decisions we make, and the culture that makes us special. We elevate talent. 🙌 We build trust. 🤝 We thrive together. 🌍
  
  
Our mission is to create a more equal world—one global hire at a time. Everything we do ladders up to our mission—and that doesn’t just mean building software. We develop programs, participate in workshops, and create dedicated teams to ensure we successfully support companies and knowledge workers in this new world of work.
  
  
We embrace asynchronous communication and collaborative work—and we share how we work in the Oyster Public HQ —to help other global teams learn from our experiences.
  
  
**💌 How YOU Work**
Different countries have different statutory benefits, different cultures have different norms, and different people have different needs! In order to best support and encourage our diverse team, we’ve created How YOU Work; a program of policies, practices, and perks to support your whole human experience as an employee at Oyster.
  
  

* Work from anywhere: Oyster is a borderless, HQ-less company. As long as your work gets done on time, your team has the support they need, and you're authorized to work where you live, the world is truly your Oyster.
* Paid time off: We’re all about taking breaks—we all need it. Oyster provides employees with 40 days off each year, which includes public/bank holidays and vacation/holiday leave (unless your country mandates more).
* Mental health support: We consider your mental health a top priority. We offer access to Plumm, a mental well-being service, to support your mental health.
* Wellbeing allowance: Each month, Oyster will top up your ThanksBen wallet with a wellbeing allowance. You can get pretty much anything that your heart desires! ThanksBen offers a wide array of options for spending your wellbeing allowance. Check out their benefits catalogue here for inspiration.
* Flexible parental leave: Families are created in lots of different ways. Our parental leave policy applies to all employees who are becoming parents, regardless of how they become a parent. Oysters are eligible for a minimum of three months of paid parental leave and your job will be held for 12 months (or longer if required by local jurisdiction).
* WFH stipend: Stipend to spend on your laptop and any other equipment you need for your home office; we'll get you up and running in no time!

**✨ The best jobs should be available to everyone**
At Oyster, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences and we’ve intentionally built our product and our company with an inclusive, global mindset. We know from experience that people from underrepresented groups often don’t apply for roles they don’t feel they meet all the criteria for. We’re committed to elevating talent by creating a trust-based environment where we can all thrive together. So if you think you have what it takes, but don’t necessarily check every single box, please consider applying. We’d love to hear how you might contribute to our mission and our team.
  
  
Oyster is committed to ensuring equal opportunity of employment for qualified persons with disabilities and actively fosters an inclusive work environment. If you require reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process, please email jobs@oysterhr.com with the subject line: Interview Accommodations.
  
  
Our available positions are published on our careers page and should you be invited to interview with us, our recruitment team will only ever contact you directly from an @oysterhr.com email address.
**We will never ask you to send us money as part of a job offer.**
If you receive a suspicious email relating to opportunities at Oyster from any other email domain where someone is claiming to be a part of our recruitment team, or are directed to anywhere other than www.oysterhr.com/careers to view our available jobs we encourage you to submit a report through our Compliance and Ethics Helpline.

title: Sales and Success Enablement Coordinator
description:
Lensa is the leading career site for job seekers at every stage of their career. Our client, Scholastic, is seeking professionals. Apply via Lensa today!
  
  
**Job Description**
The Enablement Coordinator will play a crucial role in supporting the Training and Enablement teams by coordinating Sales and Success Enablement activities to ensure alignment with the company’s goals and initiatives. This role requires a proactive individual with excellent communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally. The main duties include organizing & coordinating various programs, events and activities to improve experience, efficiency, stakeholder expectations and overall outcomes.
  
  
**Key Responsibilities**
**Enablement Coordination and Communication:**

* Collaborate with the Training & Enablement teams to coordinate enablement activities and ensure effective communication.
* Schedule regular meetings to keep the team aligned and informed, including lunch and learns, leader sessions, SME meetings, and focus groups.
* Provide administrative support to the Training and Enablement teams including compiling a list of learner module completion from learning center.
* Collaborate with sales, success, marketing, product, and operations teams. e. Gather feedback and align enablement initiatives with business goals. f. Ensure smooth information flow across teams.

**Content Management**

* Maintain a library of sales and success enablement content, including presentations, playbooks, processes, and marketing collateral.
* Cultivate Vendor Partnerships: Build and maintain relationships with third-party vendors, staying informed about new platform features and capabilities. c. Stay informed about new platform features and capabilities.
* Manage user access, troubleshoot issues, and coordinate feature rollouts to optimize platform utilization.

**Sales and Success Processes**

* Partner with Director, Sales & Success Enablement and Process; Director, Sales & Success Strategy Performance and Technology; and Sr. Manager, Sales & Success Training to optimize processes to maximize efficiency and productivity.
* Collaborate with Sales and Customer Success leadership to gather insight and data to optimize the processes to maximize efficiency and productivity.

**Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities**

* Strong project management skills to plan and coordinate enablement and training activities effectively.
* Excellent communication and strong collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

3 Understanding of sales processes, methodologies, and customer lifecycle.
  
  

* High level of proficiency and expertise with MS Office software, Google Drive, Salesforce/CRM technology, Enablement technology, and telecommuting/collaboration software such as, Microsoft Teams or Zoom. 5. Familiarization with children’s literature, Book Fairs, and school activities is a plus.
* Ability to execute a vision, manage multiple priorities, and achieve results through a balanced and organized work plan.
* Outstanding interpersonal skills with peers, superiors (cross functional and throughout the organization) and customers.

**Qualifications**
**Experience:**
Experience in sales, sales operations, or a related role with a focus on training and enablement. Familiarity with CRM systems and sales enablement tools. Experience with Virtual kick-off meetings a plus.
  
  
**Education:**
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant experience in Business Administration, Management, or related field, including sales expertise, effectiveness and partnership competencies as outlined above.
  
  
The pay range for this position is $24.00 to $27.40 per hour.
  
  
**Time Type**
Full time
  
  
**Job Type**
Regular
  
  
**Job Family Group**
Sales
  
  
**Location Region/State:**
Florida

title: Director of Sales Enablement
description:
Qualified is the Agentic Marketing Platform for B2B companies. With Piper the AI SDR Agent, Qualified offers a whole new way to grow inbound pipeline. Piper operates across both the website and email, working to engage website visitors, capture leads, and convert buyers into pipeline around the clock. Hundreds of the world’s leading brands—including Crunchbase, Asana, Box, and Grubhub—choose Qualified to increase lead conversions, generate more meetings, and improve efficiency within their inbound pipeline motion.
  
  
**Overview**
Qualified is the Agentic Marketing Platform for B2B companies. As we scale our go-to-market motion, we’re investing in world-class enablement — and we’re bringing Highspot online as our centralized content and learning hub.
  
  
We’re hiring a Director of Sales Enablement to lead and evolve how we enable our AEs, BDRs, and SEs — from onboarding and ramp to continuous development and deal support. This leader will drive strategy, execution, and field impact — while owning the enablement systems and experiences that power our teams, including full accountability for the success of Highspot.
  
  
**Responsibilities**

* Own the Sales Learning Experience: Design, build, and continuously improve a modern, blended learning ecosystem that ramps reps fast and reinforces mastery across all stages of the sales journey.
* Lead Highspot Strategy & Execution: Serve as the internal owner for Highspot, driving its configuration, content governance, adoption, and measurement to ensure reps always have the right content, at the right time, for the right buyer.
* Build Scalable Enablement Programs: Develop and manage scalable learning experiences, playbooks, and certifications that accelerate time-to-productivity and impact at every level.
* Partner Cross-Functionally: Work closely with Sales Leaders, Product Marketing, and RevOps to align enablement initiatives with revenue goals and evolving GTM strategy.
* Measure What Matters: Define and report on enablement KPIs (time to productivity, certification rates, content usage, win rates) and translate insights into action.
* Be a Culture Carrier: Champion a culture of continuous learning, feedback, and excellence; empower managers to reinforce skills through coaching and frontline execution.

**Experience**

* 7-10 years of experience in Sales Enablement or GTM Enablement roles, with 3+ years in a leadership role building and scaling programs in a high-growth B2B SaaS environment
* Proven expertise designing adult learning experiences, certification programs, and manager-led coaching playbooks
* Hands-on experience owning and driving adoption of Highspot (or similar platform) at scale
* Familiarity with system integrations (Salesforce, Gong, Outreach) and content taxonomy best practices
* Strong partnership mindset — a trusted collaborator to Sales, Marketing, and RevOps leaders.
* Data-driven and outcome-oriented: you care deeply about tying enablement to measurable revenue results.
* Exceptional communication skills, executive presence, and ability to influence at all levels
* Deep empathy for sellers and a proactive mindset that stays one step ahead of the field

**About Qualified**
Qualified is the AI pipeline generation platform for revenue teams that use Salesforce. Headquartered in San Francisco, Qualified delivers pipeline generation at scale with AI and automation for thousands of customers like Autodesk, Blackbaud, and Epson. Led by former Salesforce CMO Kraig Swensrud and former Salesforce Product SVP Sean Whiteley, Qualified boasts 900+ 5-star reviews on G2 and is ranked #1 on the Salesforce AppExchange. Qualified is funded by Sapphire, Tiger Global, Norwest Venture Partners, Redpoint Ventures, and Salesforce Ventures.
  
  
**One Team**
We’re all in this together with a shared goal: grow the business and each other. Work as a team, win as a team. Collaborate and strategize across departments to deliver A+ work. We are bold thought leaders that value creating a sense of belonging for all and celebrating our wins, big or small.
  
  
**Customer Obsessed**
Prioritize the customer above everything else. Build a product that our customers love. Establish ourselves as their trusted advisor and do “Whatever it takes” to make them successful. Prove the ROI. Only when our customers win do we win.
  
  
**Think Big & Move Fast**
We’re defining a new category and we have fierce competition. Fast-paced innovation is the name of the game. We look forward. We reimagine. We throw out new ideas. We test things. We move quickly. We challenge the norm. We don’t settle for status quo.
  
  
On the heels of their Series C financing, Qualified is looking to grow the team so that they can do even more, even faster; they’re focused on delivering our customers more innovation, additional services, an expanded product portfolio, and even deeper ties into the Salesforce CRM platform. Qualified is looking for folks that are fired up about joining a fast-paced, fast-growing company that is doing big things.
  
  
**Diversity & Inclusion**
Qualified is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together.
  
  
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Director, Sales Enablement
description:
**Director, Sales Enablement**

**Location:**
Remote (U.S.)

**Reports to:**
Chief Revenue Officer (CRO)

**About Zywave**

Zywave is the leading provider of cloud-based software powering the growth of insurance and financial professionals. Serving more than 15,000 customers, we help agencies sharpen risk insights, streamline workflows, and deliver better customer experiences. Our ecosystem-wide platform fuels profitable growth in a rapidly evolving risk landscape — and we’re just getting started.

**The Opportunity**

We’re seeking a strategic and hands-on
**Director of Sales Enablement**
to build and lead a world-class enablement function that drives performance across our global sales organization.

In this role, you'll be the architect behind how Zywave educates, equips, and empowers its revenue teams. You’ll design a structured, scalable enablement program — from onboarding and product launches to pipeline acceleration and deal strategy — all with one goal: turning potential into performance at every stage of the sales journey.

This is a highly visible leadership role that will partner cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Marketing, and RevOps to accelerate revenue and elevate the customer conversation.

**What You’ll Own**

* **Sales Onboarding & Training:**
* Design and implement a modern, metrics-driven onboarding experience with clear milestones and ramp benchmarks across sales roles.
* **Sales Readiness & Product Knowledge:**
* Partner with Product Marketing and Product Management to ensure reps are fully trained and confident on positioning, differentiation, and objection handling — especially during launches or new integrations.
* **Sales Tools & Content:**
* Equip reps with the right content at the right time. Optimize tool adoption (e.g., Salesforce, enablement platforms) and ensure alignment across the tech stack.
* **Performance Insights:**
* Track enablement KPIs and sales performance data to continuously optimize programs. Turn insights into action that drives win rates, ACV, and sales velocity.
* **Process Optimization:**
* Identify friction in the sales process and implement training, playbooks, or tools that help reps move deals through the funnel more efficiently.
* **Coaching & Leadership Alignment:**
* Work closely with frontline managers and sales leadership to reinforce best practices and build a culture of continuous learning.

**Who You Are**

* 10+ years in B2B SaaS sales, enablement, or revenue operations, with 3+ years in a senior enablement leadership role
* Deep knowledge of the sales lifecycle, methodologies (e.g., MEDDICC, Challenger), and high-velocity SaaS environments
* Exceptional communicator and collaborator with experience working cross-functionally across Sales, Product, and Marketing
* Expert at designing structured, scalable enablement programs rooted in data and performance metrics
* Proficient in Salesforce, enablement platforms (e.g., Highspot, Seismic), and sales analytics tools
* Passionate about coaching, content, and creating clarity for customer-facing teams
* Experience enabling both new business and account management teams a plus

**Why Zywave?**

* Join a fast-growing SaaS leader disrupting the insurtech space
* Lead a high-impact function that directly influences revenue
* Competitive salary, equity, and benefits
* Collaborative, forward-thinking team with real autonomy
* 15,000+ customers and growing — make your mark at scale

title: Lead Customer Success Business Analyst
description:
**Company Overview**
With 80,000 customers across 150 countries, UKG is the largest U.S.-based private software company in the world. And we’re only getting started. Ready to bring your bold ideas and collaborative mindset to an organization that still has so much more to build and achieve? Read on.
  
  
At UKG, you get more than just a job. You get to work with purpose. Our team of U Krewers are on a mission to inspire every organization to become a great place to work through our award-winning HR technology built for all.
  
  
Here, we know that you’re more than your work. That’s why our benefits help you thrive personally and professionally, from wellness programs and tuition reimbursement to U Choose — a customizable expense reimbursement program that can be used for more than 200+ needs that best suit you and your family, from student loan repayment, to childcare, to pet insurance. Our inclusive culture, active and engaged employee resource groups, and caring leaders value every voice and support you in doing the best work of your career. If you’re passionate about our purpose — people —then we can’t wait to support whatever gives you purpose.
**We’re united by purpose, inspired by you.**
The Customer Success Business Analyst role will support our Relationship Management team and the GTM Strategy & Planning team across UKG Globally. The responsibilities will revolve around analyzing data across our over 20,000 contracts and over $3.5B in recurring revenue per year, identifying trends, optimizing processes, and collaborating with Sales, Customer Success, Renewals, Finance, and our UKG Operations teams to maximize retention and revenue. The role will perform complex analyses of business goals, financial data, objectives, and needs of the general business environment. They will analyze key metrics, identify risks, and collaborate with stakeholders to ensure customer success and timely/accurate renewals.
  
  
**Key Responsibilities**

* Work directly with Group Vice President (managing Renewals and Customer Success), VP of Customer Success, and Finance to analyze adoption trends and customer data to identify risks, opportunities, and areas for improvement
* Work with the GTM Advanced Analytics team and Finance to develop tools, dashboards, and workflows to improve efficiency and visibility
* Partner with members of the GTM function to provide program support for growth initiatives (i.e. Sales Plays, pipeline hygiene)
* Prepare and deliver reports on renewal performance, customer sentiment/retention, and revenue forecasts with deep collaboration across the Revenue Operations team in Finance.
* Track and report on key metrics such as renewal rates, sentiment, churn rates, and upsell opportunities for sales to engage
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline and enhance current Customer Success programs
* Assist in creating strategies for improving customer satisfactions and loyalty
* Communicate renewal insights and findings to key stakeholders and leadership
* Support procure to pay, budgeting, and resource planning
* Align and help manage territories for the CSM team during annual planning and ad-hoc onboarding territory planning
* Serve as the trusted advisor and go-to-resource for the Customer Success team for any questions relating to Salesforce, sales tools, and/or general ad-hoc requests
* Responsible for ensuring that Account data is accurate in Salesforce and other systems
* Direct liaison between CS and Salesforce Enablement team
* Create custom reports, dashboards, and fields to support CS
* Partner with Enablement team to build out and iterate upon Relationship Management New Hire Onboarding and Orientation
* Support Quarterly Business Review preparation and slideware

**Basic Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Finance, Data Analytics, or a related field
* 3-5+ years of experience supporting a Customer Success team with business analysis and project management
* Experience in SaaS or technology industries
* Strong desire for business partnership and pursuing a goal of being a trusted business advisor to field leadership
* 3+ years' experience in Excel, Power BI, and Salesforce.com is required
* Proficient in Microsoft Office including PowerPoint and Word
* Knowledge of subscription management software (e.g., Gainsight)

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication, with active listening and summarization skills
* Ability to proactively influence, advise, and collaborate with teams
* Excellent judgment, interpersonal, communication skills, and follow-through
* Ability to work in a team environment and cross-functionally
* Highly self-motivated, analytical with demonstrated problem solving, and have sound business decision making skills in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to build credibility, trust, and rapport with stakeholders at all levels

**Where we’re going**
UKG is on the cusp of something truly special. Worldwide, we already hold the #1 market share position for workforce management and the #2 position for human capital management. Tens of millions of frontline workers start and end their days with our software, with billions of shifts managed annually through UKG solutions today. Yet it’s our AI-powered product portfolio designed to support customers of all sizes, industries, and geographies that will propel us into an even brighter tomorrow!
  
  
Equal Opportunity Employer
  
  
UKG is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, disability, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, and other legally protected categories.
  
  
View The EEO Know Your Rights poster
  
  
UKG participates in E-Verify. View the E-Verify posters here .
  
  
It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.
  
  
Disability Accommodation in the Application and Interview Process
  
  
For individuals with disabilities that need additional assistance at any point in the application and interview process, please email UKGCareers@ukg.com .
  
  
The base salary range for this position is $99,800 to$143,450; however, base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge and location. This position is also eligible for commissions and restricted stock unit awards as part of total compensation.  Information about UKG’s comprehensive benefits can be reviewed on our careers site at https://www.ukg.com/careers
